content:
Diagnosis
	1. Right upper lobe lung adenocarcinoma, T1aN0M0
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 VATS right upper lobectomy with lymph node dissection

	Radiotherapy
	Not indicated

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Mild post-operative chest wall pain

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today at 3-month post-operative follow-up. [redacted name] has made an excellent recovery from surgery. Experiencing only mild intermittent chest wall discomfort requiring occasional paracetamol. No concerning respiratory symptoms. Maintaining good exercise tolerance with daily walks.

On examination, surgical wounds well healed. Chest clear with good air entry bilaterally. No concerning features.

Latest chest x-ray (12 Apr 2024) shows expected post-operative changes with no concerning features.

	Further investigations
	Surveillance CT chest/abdomen/pelvis booked for July 2024

	Medication prescribed
	None

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 months with CT results

	Required GP actions
	None

cancer_timeline.value: VATS right upper lobectomy with lymph node dissection
Chest x-ray shows expected post-operative changes with no concerning features

patient_facts.value: Mild intermittent chest wall discomfort requiring occasional paracetamol
Surgical wounds well healed. Chest clear with good air entry bilaterally
Maintaining good exercise tolerance with daily walks

status_updates.value: Early stage right upper lobe lung adenocarcinoma treated with curative surgery. Excellent post-operative recovery at 3 months with no evidence of disease
Surveillance CT chest/abdomen/pelvis booked for July 2024
Next oncology follow up in 3 months with CT results
